meanings.definition: Run away secretly in order to get married.
meanings.sent1: The young couple was eloping to avoid a big wedding.
meanings.sent2: They decided to elope and have a private ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The bride and groom were eloping to have a wedding adventure.
meanings.sent4: Their love was like eloping into the unknown, full of excitement.
meanings.sent5: Eloping made their love story more romantic and mysterious.

meanings.sent1: The prisoner was eloping from the jail under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: She was eloping from her responsibilities for a day of relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The cat was eloping from the bath, trying to avoid getting wet.
meanings.sent4: His mind was eloping from reality into a world of fantasy.
meanings.sent5: Eloping from the chaos brought her a moment of peace.

meanings.sent1: The deer was eloping from the approaching predator.
meanings.sent2: People were eloping from the storm to seek shelter.
meanings.sent3: The mouse was eloping from the cat, trying to stay safe.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were eloping from the stressful situation, seeking calm.
meanings.sent5: Eloping from danger was their only chance for survival.
